sentences.sContent: At first there was a lack of trust between them.
sentences.sCn: 起初，他们之间缺乏信任。

sentences.sContent: an agreement made on the basis of mutual trust
sentences.sCn: 在相互信任的基础上达成的一项协议

sentences.sContent: You betrayed your father’s trust (= did something bad even though he trusted you ).
sentences.sCn: 你辜负了你父亲对你的信任。

sentences.sContent: The money your father left you will be held in trust until you are 21.
sentences.sCn: 你父亲留给你的钱将被托管到你满21岁。

sentences.sContent: ...it not only serves as crucial bridge to build trust and connection between two generations but also exerts a profound and subtle influence toward to children’s personal growth...
...the most important character doctor should have is professional ethics that is the foremost way to gain trust from patients...
...Bond has a lot of trust in you...
...Who can trust someone who is dishonest or unfair...
...How did the man mentioned in the newspaper try to win further trust from the victims...

phrases.pCn: 不加深究地，不加考察地；不赁证据
单位信托公司；投资公司；联合托拉斯
n. 国民托管组织（英国保护名胜古迹的私人组织）

words.tran: 托管；托管制度；托管人职责；托管领土
移交（财产或管理权）给受托人

trans.tranOther: a strong belief in the honesty, goodness etc of someone or something
to believe that someone is honest or will not do anything bad or wrong
